DOC.brief_title: Incidence Of Hemidiaphragmatic Paralysis After Usg Guided Low Dose Interscalene Brachial Plexus Block
DOC.detailed_description: to put a catheter in interscalene brachial plexus USG guided and give a bolus of drug followed by 24 hours continous infusion of drug. To see hemidiaphragmatic paralysis by seeing diaphragmatic excursion on M mode Usg subcostal approach, to see post operative pain, patient satisfaction score, complications if any
DOC.criteria: Patients aged 1880 years and belonging to ASA grade I, II, III, undergoing either, shoulder surgery, (rotator cuff repair, acromioplasty, hemiarthroplasty, and total shoulder replacement) or surgery for proximal humerus fracture will be recruited for the study. a) Patient refusal for interscalene block b) Severe respiratory disease (FEV1/FVC <0.7 and FEV1 < 80% of predicted) c) Allergy to amide local anaesthetic drugs d) Chronic opioid therapy e) Patients who cannot understand how to operate PCA and VAS
